page.title: 17THE LOOSE SWISS SCOUTS
page.content: The Loose Swiss Scout Group was started in 1908 by 'Skipper' Jack Barcham Green. The name 'Swiss' comes from the connections he had with Switzerland through both his family hand-made paper-making business and also his marriage into a Swiss family. The Group's HQ in Pickering Street was bought for Â£125 in 1942. More recently the Group was given the chance to buy 45 acres of the Loose Valley for Â£25,000 by the landowner Miss Joan Foster Clarke. In 1982, with the purchase completed, the land was named Swiss Valley and dedicated in the presence of 97-year old 'Skipper' Green. Since when members and supporters of the Group have worked hard on a programme of management and conservation, and the land has been used for a wide range of scouting activities.
